title: Its really confusing to me whats going on with top lane atm
body:
Im watching a random game from hashinshins stream rn for fun and basically, he shoves Maokai out and beats him in lane as Aatrox. Even when the Maokai finished Bramble Vest and the lane was even, hashinshin beat him. Later he goes on about tanks being unbeatable and the most overpowered a class has ever been since like Season 3.   
But back in reality, the {{item:3153}} {{item:3044}} {{item:1028}} {{item:3047}} hashinshin beats the {{item:3068}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3076}} {{item:3067}} Maokai 1v1. No Mercs, 0 MR. 
And of course he won the game because Maokai got outscaled like most tanks do.

Normally Id just say "its hashinshin" but everyone seems to agree with him so.. whats the deal here?
The game Im talking about if anyone wants to watch it https://www.twitch.tv/videos/229806722?t=09h23m37s

Edit: the link doesnt seem to work for me lel, its at 9 hours 23 minutes tho
https://i.gyazo.com/657f2b7b74b47f6a4dac38890bbd08d7.png

replies.body:
i wouldnt agree with him on tanks in specific. but there are two valid points to consider.

a) a lot of top lane mains actually quit top lane and swapped to other roles, and more are still quitting. its currently the least picked out of all 5 positions **including support**. this means the few top lane mains who are left mostly face auto filled players, which kindof skews the matchups and statistics in a way, where the top mains who are more familiar with the champions and matchups win their lane more often

b) top lane overall has very little agency over the game. if you dont play a tank whos main job is to provide utility in teamfights and plays very similar to a support and just peels for his marksman, youll have almost no impact on the game. winning or losing top matter very little, since most games are almost exclusively decided by the outcome of bot lane and end before top lane bruisers or carries have a chance to have a major influence.

the conditions for top lane bruisers to get into a position to carry are quite ridiculous. you have to be in absolute control of your lane with a large cs lead and be able to get turret first blood before it can go to one of the bot lane duos. if one of those conditions isnt met, youre getting outscaled by bot lane before the lane phase ends, and will never even be able to catch up.

Same thing goes for mid then tho unless you count "doing nothing in lane and camping bot" carrying feelsbadman
I also heard neace saying top is the best role to solo carry because you can get fed and no one can beat you since thats what bruisers do.

Two thing :

1) Hashinshin part
Maokai was stupid enough for not taking grasp, he could abuse Aatrox if he did this. Hashinshin didn't won the top, he wasn't even able  to apply his "lead". Zac won the top (and its without taking in account bad tps from mao).

2) mid 
Mid story about waveclear and roaming is only recent. Tanks BS isn't only since a few month. And mid will always be able to impact. Mid can help jungler to secure scuttle, can help him during invade (top have poor waveclear)... 
"fed and no one can beat you" if u are against a tank you won't be able to. 


i think neace speak for low elo (like very low elo). And we could argue about this.
Tanks arent good top anymore tho, so at least the story about wave clear mage mid is true hehe.

Cam is disgusting since release.
Sion is fine imo.
Gp abuses klepto and he will be gutted to unplayability if the pbe nerfs hit live.
Reng?Way too hard to play post lane unless the enemy already losing.

the rest are just random champs that are barely relevant
I kind of have to disagree on Sion. He definitely feels *very* overbearing in lane with comet. Late game he's still fine though imo.

>
> I kind of have to disagree on Sion. He definitely feels *very* overbearing in lane with comet. Late game he's still fine though imo.

PLayed against him today. And the only reason i didnt hardstomp him was because i fucked up my E as cam. He is squishy as fuck and easily abusable.
Your match history says that Sion was 6/1/6. He also built only 30 armor from Righteous Glory along with maxing W last, which is probably why he felt squishy to you.
Squishy ?? Come on u played Camille !!! despite this u lost.

> [{quoted}](name=silver 5 btw,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2udPEN3i,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-02-17T23:49:45.044+0000)
>

> Gp abuses klepto and he will be gutted to unplayability if the pbe nerfs hit live.

> the rest are just random champs that are barely relevant

sion is not anywhere near fine , i played against him as gp i as abusing klepto and got my full build he still shit on me hard even tough he got ganked 4  times cause he was playing agrroo he carried the game with score of 1/6 cause he had 4000 hp from grasp and his W and he deal way to much damage
If he took grasp that's on you LMAO. He's only strong with comet + E.

Have you watched his every other game against tanks/ornn who rushed tabi bramble?

He usually goes 0-5-0 and kills himself by autoing.

While tabi and bramble are broken, the current top tier top laners are even more broken to the point where they actually beat that, like GP/Camille, those 2 champs are probably the most broken champs in the game (there are challenger camille players with over 70% winrate IN CHALLENGER) atm so it is kind of dumb that ppl say top has 0 impact.

>He usually goes 0-5-0

well.. its hashinshin hehe. Everyone camps him because they know he doesnt even care, he just TPs to a minion that is over extended right after dying to a gank all the time.
I mean I hate playing vs tanks too because defense usually beats offense in lane (theres a reason why everyone went Abyssal mid and the guy with Tabi is gonna win most of the time in a bruiser 1v1). But no tanks are really doing well rn top except Sion and kinda Singed.
Mao seems good.

Aatrox cannot contest an Ornn early game, and fighting him is blatantly suicide. You can see this with even Boxer Pete going up against Ornn. Usually Bramble Vest is just a meme because it only hurts sustain as its main cause of use, and if we're talking about negating damage like any other item, things like Glacial Shroud give CDR and MP on top of it and end with higher gold efficiency. {{item:3077}}  and {{item:3078}} are immensely popular on Aatrox because it skips past the sustain issue and goes straight for raw damage.

GP/Camille both are capable of actually assisting their team in the top lane compared to most of the roster. This is backed further by their "passable" early games that in past seasons were literal garbage unless they were at their overtuned state. Capable of teamfighting but not exactly their overall forte, solo queue is more about picks and these champions are near god status in being capable of doing that.

Many other top laners either have an "eh" keystone or in general have lower base stats than what is needed to scale properly from the lane itself. 

Base AD going up ironically helps everyone *but* the top laner, since you still go practically glass cannon and only *later* itemize tanky. Remember Atmog's? Remember unkillable bruisers that just stacked that? THAT was when bruisers were viable. When they built tanky and were capable of being raid bosses on their own. Undeniably outscaled tanks, and I remember picking a tank back in the day was basically trolling unless it was an ultra-specific one (i.e. Singed, Mundo, Shen).

Funny how bruisers rely that heavily on tank itemization and base damages. At the end of the day you were a tank with less CC and more damage, and now all of the builds are all glass cannon first, tanky later. And with the pace of games right now, the tank stats come way too late or *not at all.* There's no balance for bruisers and they'd need a hell of a lot of work rather than simple buffs/nerfs.

Wait what? The second maokai got bramble, it should've been obvious he had aatrox beat. That Maokai made a mistake worse than a bronze player where he tps in front of aatrox's face where aatrox gets free hits and damage off without retaliation. Lol.

And that's only part of it. You seem to have conveniently left out the part where about 15minutes after that he starts getting his back demolished by said Maokai.

So you base your opinion entirely of one game where additionally maokai played like boosted kid completely not respecting hashinshin. While you can be bad and still pull it off picking a tank, if you're straight up dumb you won't win even picking tank and that's the case with maokai player. 

Have you seen any other game? It literally is impossible to beat a tank. And Aatrox unlike everyone else claim, isn't bad which hash proved already. Tank e.g. ornn spams abilities off cooldown, having no mana issues, his abilities being barely possible to avoid and out damaging a champion who is supposed to deal damage and have better sustain.

 And that top lane champions in challenger you listed here. Half of them need nerfs/adjustments and the other half is barely picked and only viable by one tricks.

I thought you can be autofilled top and braindead and still win by picking a tank? 
Ornn barely has 48% win rate and most other tanks arent that good either, so...
win rate doesnt mean if champion is strong or not. how many times do I have to repeat this sht.
i can something... Despite playing poorly, the maokai didn't really lose top so badly in 1v1 situation, gank and poor tp was what won top.

Everything points towards top lane being the best lane in the game right now.  In the lcs top lane champs are running rampant. The forums are living last season where adc's literally stood still and auto attacked everyone to death.

Its just going to take them time to catch up on the reality of the situation. 

Pretty much the forums are living in the past and refuse to acknowledge whats going on.

Running rampant. You mean the ornn/cho gath every single game? 
Or the camille/GP who might as well not exist? 
Do you even watch pro games? 
Sadly i watched a few games yesterday don't give me this bullshit how good toplane is ESPECIALLY IN PROPLAY because they are beyond fuckin useless if not playing tanks.

> [{quoted}](name=GayFluffyUnicorn,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2udPEN3i,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-02-18T09:53:50.726+0000)

I mean did you even bother to watch clg vs tl? Due to camille's spilt push his team got 2 barons

And in the last team fight he pretty much zoned out the support and adc and then assassinated the adc. 

I honestly don't know what games you are watching.
Dont insert logic, when it's a game where top carries they will say "it's just X games, it doesnt mean anything" but if any other lane pops off they screech how they cant solo carry 1v5.

> [{quoted}](name=GayFluffyUnicorn,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2udPEN3i,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-02-18T09:53:50.726+0000)

Dude you just proved yourself wrong
Why does Riven have a 12.5% pick rate?
Cuz riven is mega busted every season and riot ensures it stays like this. Kinda makes you question how hard she is to play considering she also has a high average winrate.

mega busted due riot. Are u saying her last buffs wasn't needed ?

>V8.3
Stats
Base health regeneration increased to 5.5 from 5.34.
V7.24
Broken Wings Broken Wings
Base damage increased to 15 / 35 / 55 / 75 / 95 from 10 / 30 / 50 / 70 / 90.
AD ratio increased to 45 / 50 / 55 / 60 / 65% AD from 40 / 45 / 50 / 55 / 60% AD.

are u a conspiracy theorist{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
hashinshin is right on everything except the part where "tanks are broken and beat everything"
What is the other stuff then? Junglers having too much impact, supports and adcs being too strong, etc.? Because that stuff doesnt only affect bruisers or top lane then.

and?
he never said that it only affected bruisers

also he pointed out a huge issue that is %hp damage on tanks when bruisers have no MR at all and their first 3 items are only HP

the thing where hash mistook was tanks autowinnig lane with bramble vest+ninja tabi
that's a pure myth

But he says every other role/class is fine or overpowered,
And if tanks have too much %hp damage vs bruisers but tanks arent even good atm,.. is there a problem? I mean you could shift that power to something else but what he seems to want is just a direct nerf to tanks and a nerf to all of their items kek

No
He said ADC is fine, and support is broken, jungle is broken
he never talked about mid

never said mid is fine
never said mid is weak
never said mid is overpowered

so don't try to change what he said

Also tanks may not be a problem, but an ornn/cho/shen dealing as much damage as a bruiser is still frustrating
especially when your 3 first items are autocountered by a tank

In some video he said something like "mid is mostly fine, just that liandrys is probably too strong". He also said "if something is broken you just wave clear against it so its not a problem", basically ignoring melee mid laners.

Honestly Cho is pretty much the only tank that does this much damage. Have u seen Tri Force Irelia with Press the Attack? Unless you mean tanks beating bruisers 1v1 because of armor, they dont do more or as much damage.

> [{quoted}](name=Diamond2Kappa,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2udPEN3i,comment-id=000700000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-18T14:16:58.818+0000)

HE
DOESNT
GIVE
A FUCK
ABOUT MIDLANE

just like me
we're toplane mains, do you think we will start to look down at mid issues?
if you're a midlane main that's what you do
if you're a toplane main, you look for top
if we are concerned about supports being broken and junglers having too much impact it's because it impacts top

anything that only impact mid doesn't matter to us

Not caring about mid lane =/= saying "it is fine" tho. If he doesnt care about it, he shouldnt talk about its state. 
And if he wants to talk about the game and about top lane being the worst role, he should know whats happening in other roles. 

top = tanks are frustrating but not strong
mid = mages are frustrating and crowding out other picks/too strong

seems like one role out of those has bigger issues to me heh

> [{quoted}](name=Diamond2Kappa,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2udPEN3i,comment-id=00070000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-18T15:34:03.244+0000)

No he should not
we all know that popularity wise top is the worst
no one wants to play top

if you think mid is not fine, all those people selecting mid would prove you wrong
go debate with them about if mid is fine or not

until then half of toplaner mains left top, that should REALLY say something

Mid has always been the most popular role, top has always been one of the least popular roles. 

So tanks arent very strong but almost everyone that agrees with hashinshin says tanks are overpowered and need to be gutted. What else is the point then? Is it fine once they make a keystone for aa bruisers?

> Mid has always been the most popular role, top has always been one of the least popular roles.

that is false, during my time of league I've seen top fluctuate in popularity for sure, but it's never "always" been one of the least popular roles. Mid has been, but it's also been very alienating at times. During the assassin meta it was definitely popular, but only for assassin players. Every other mid laner was forced to leave mid or play Malz or some shit.

The only 2 roles that have remained relatively consistent in popularity in my time of playing league has been ADC and Support

u statement about cho is so retarded. It would be like a toplaner a "few" patches ago saying Sona deal nothing. ur pov is biased cause u only encounter tanks during teamfight and cause mid and adc are the threats at this time.

>the thing where hash mistook was tanks autowinnig lane with bramble vest+ninja tabi
that's a pure myth

when Mao got tabi/bramble he couldn't kill him alone. and imagine if mao was smart enough and choose grasp over aftershock

In hashinshins situation, junglers having too much impact means he can get camped and lose the lane every game since he is very recognizable, and in high elos there is more ghosting scenarios and people with a grudge or that want to be a troll and make hashinshin have a horrible game.
Early game junglers do have too much impact in soloq in general tho
So everyone in SoloQ is in a high enough elo to be ghosted, notorious enough to be camped, and is also trolled all the time? Dude.
? Why do laners need to be ghosted/trolled for junglers to have too much impact? They can just gank too much and too effectively.

I'm talking about how it affects hashinshin specifically. Maybe you don't know what ghosting is, but ghosting is putting a stream on in the background while on the team opposite of the streamer so you can see the map and know where they are. Why do you think streamers cover their own maps sometimes? It affects hashinshin even moreso considering there is a hate train (specifically high elo) against him. There is even a game where an ezreal ganks THREE times before hashinshin hit level 5 with red buff and killed him all 3 times, one of the ganks being before he reaches his own tower. I'm pretty sure soloQ doesn't have that shit happening.

I dont think its a "hate train", its just that hashinshin overextends permanently so why not make use of that? 
And if you want to, you can camp any laner as jungler, why not?

It is very much a hate train or a trend with the same nature as "ez". Also it's not "just that" you think he overextended twice after he died to ezreal the first time? NO. I even told you that beforehand. Again, stop asking stupid questions. What is so hard to understand that in "hashinshins situation" he has it worse in top lane by far, due to him being high elo, notorious and the fact its a meme to camp him. Saying "who wouldn't camp a laner as jungler" doesn't answer my question at all.
Of course people camp the guy that perma tilts and overextends, if you want to call it a hate train, I guess..
